<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatv-object"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Tuple&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatv-object/#a974591deeb830e3934264cf6b34fefbe">formatv&#95;object</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatv-object-base/#a5ecf8eb658bde7495b1e140fc67668d4">formatv&#95;object&#95;base</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Storage for the parameter adapters.  Since the base class erases the type</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the parameters, we have to own the storage for the parameters here, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have the base class store type-erased pointers into this tuple.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal">  Tuple Parameters;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::array&lt;support::detail::format&#95;adapter &#42;, std::tuple&#95;size&lt;Tuple&gt;::value&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal">      ParameterPointers;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The parameters are stored in a std::tuple, which does not provide runtime</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// indexing capabilities.  In order to enable runtime indexing, we use this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// structure to put the parameters into a std::array.  Since the parameters</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are not all the same type, we use some type-erasure by wrapping the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// parameters in a template class that derives from a non-template superclass.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Essentially, we are converting a std::tuple&lt;Derived&lt;Ts...&gt;&gt; to a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// std::array&lt;Base&#42;&gt;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">create&#95;adapters &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... Ts&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">    std::array&lt;support::detail::format&#95;adapter &#42;, std::tuple&#95;size&lt;Tuple&gt;::value&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">    operator()(Ts &amp;...Items) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;&#123;&amp;Items...&#125;&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Format text given a format string and replacement parameters.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ===General Description===</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Formats textual output.  &#96;Fmt&#96; is a string consisting of one or more</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// replacement sequences with the following grammar:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// rep&#95;field ::= &quot;&#123;&quot; &#91;index&#93; &#91;&quot;,&quot; layout&#93; &#91;&quot;:&quot; format&#93; &quot;&#125;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// index     ::= &lt;non-negative integer&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// layout    ::= &#91;&#91;&#91;char&#93;loc&#93;width&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// format    ::= &lt;any string not containing &quot;&#123;&quot; or &quot;&#125;&quot;&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// char      ::= &lt;any character except &quot;&#123;&quot; or &quot;&#125;&quot;&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loc       ::= &quot;-&quot; | &quot;=&quot; | &quot;+&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// width     ::= &lt;positive integer&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// index   - An optional non-negative integer specifying the index of the item</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           in the parameter pack to print. Any other value is invalid. If its</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           not specified, it will be automatically assigned a value based on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           the order of rep&#95;field seen in the format string. Note that mixing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           automatic and explicit index in the same call is an error and will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           fail validation in assert-enabled builds.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// layout  - A string controlling how the field is laid out within the available</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// format  - A type-dependent string used to provide additional options to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           the formatting operation.  Refer to the documentation of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           various individual format providers for per-type options.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// char    - The padding character.  Defaults to &#39; &#39; (space).  Only valid if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           &#96;loc&#96; is also specified.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loc     - Where to print the formatted text within the field.  Only valid if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           &#96;width&#96; is also specified.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           &#39;-&#39; : The field is left aligned within the available space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           &#39;=&#39; : The field is centered within the available space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           &#39;+&#39; : The field is right aligned within the available space (this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                 is the default).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// width   - The width of the field within which to print the formatted text.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           If this is less than the required length then the &#96;char&#96; and &#96;loc&#96;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           fields are ignored, and the field is printed with no leading or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           trailing padding.  If this is greater than the required length,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           then the text is output according to the value of &#96;loc&#96;, and padded</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//           as appropriate on the left and/or right by &#96;char&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ===Special Characters===</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The characters &#39;&#123;&#39; and &#39;&#125;&#39; are reserved and cannot appear anywhere within a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// replacement sequence.  Outside of a replacement sequence, in order to print</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a literal &#39;&#123;&#39; it must be doubled as &quot;&#123;&#123;&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ===Parameter Indexing===</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;index&#96; specifies the index of the parameter in the parameter pack to format</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into the output.  Note that it is possible to refer to the same parameter</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// index multiple times in a given format string.  This makes it possible to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// output the same value multiple times without passing it multiple times to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function. For example:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   formatv(&quot;&#123;0&#125; &#123;1&#125; &#123;0&#125;&quot;, &quot;a&quot;, &quot;bb&quot;)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// would yield the string &quot;abba&quot;.  This can be convenient when it is expensive</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to compute the value of the parameter, and you would otherwise have had to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// save it to a temporary.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ===Formatter Search===</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For a given parameter of type T, the following steps are executed in order</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// until a match is found:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   1 If the parameter is of class type, and inherits from format&#95;adapter,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      Then format() is invoked on it to produce the formatted output.  The</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      implementation should write the formatted text into &#96;Stream&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   2 If there is a suitable template specialization of format&#95;provider&lt;&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      for type T containing a method whose signature is:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      void format(const T &amp;Obj, raw&#95;ostream &amp;Stream, StringRef Options)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      Then this method is invoked as described in Step 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   3 If an appropriate operator&lt;&lt; for raw&#95;ostream exists, it will be used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      For this to work, (raw&#95;ostream&amp; &lt;&lt; const T&amp;) must return raw&#95;ostream&amp;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If a match cannot be found through either of the above methods, a compiler</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// error is generated.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ===Invalid Format String Handling===</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In the case of a format string which does not match the grammar described</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// above, the output is undefined.  With asserts enabled, LLVM will trigger an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// assertion.  Otherwise, it will try to do something reasonable, but in general</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the details of what that is are undefined.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// formatv() with validation enable/disable controlled by the first argument.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... Ts&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a653cce37b80c03eebe7a00520a8eabb6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a653cce37b80c03eebe7a00520a8eabb6">formatv</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Validate, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Fmt, Ts &amp;&amp;...Vals) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Params = std::make&#95;tuple(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/support/detail/#a7b7c745d9aa9e637371b87e5905f3fdc">support::detail::build&#95;format&#95;adapter</a>(std::forward&lt;Ts&gt;(Vals))...);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/formatv-object">formatv&#95;object&lt;decltype(Params)&gt;</a>(Fmt, std::move(Params), Validate);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// formatv() with validation enabled.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a27ca159b55c777fe871aeda55df19be1"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... Ts&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a653cce37b80c03eebe7a00520a8eabb6">formatv</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Fmt, Ts &amp;&amp;...Vals) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
